title: The world's least visited countries – have you been to any of them?
text:
Not every nation can be a France or a Spain – but which countries see the fewest visitors? We took a look at the United Nations World Tourism Organisation's (UNWTO) stats for 2018...

Europe – Liechtenstein: 87,000 (up from 79,000 in 2017)

Europe's second least visited country, with an estimated 87,000 arrivals in 2018, according to the United Nations World Tourism Organisation (UNWTO), is Liechtenstein. That's a rise of seven per cent on 2017. So what are we all missing? This German-speaking sliver between Austria and Switzerland has astounding mountain scenery, apt for hiking, mountain biking and winter sports, and Vaduz Castle, a 12th century fortress. The eponymous capital has a fine contemporary art gallery – and a postal museum.

Can I visit? Yes. See liechtenstein.li
